title: 108_hr4634
content:
The "Terrorism Insurance Backstop Extension Act of 2004" extends the Terrorism Insurance Program. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to define Program Years 4 and 5, and adjust the insurer deductible. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to define Program Years 4 and 5, and adjust the insurer deductible by increasing percentages based on direct earned premiums. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to define Program Years 4 and 5, adjust the insurer deductible, and mandate availability for insurers meeting specific criteria. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to redefine Program Years 4 and 5, adjust insurer deductibles, and ensure availability for insurers meeting certain criteria. Amendments include changes to insured loss shared compensation in Program Years 3, 4, and 5. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to redefine Program Years 4 and 5, adjust insurer deductibles, and ensure availability for insurers meeting certain criteria. Amendments include changes to insured loss shared compensation in Program Years 3, 4, and 5 by adding new subparagraphs for each Program Year. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage and make technical amendments to the Act. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage and make technical amendments to the Act by inserting additional coverage options for group life insurance in various sections. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage and make technical amendments to the Act by inserting additional coverage options for group life insurance in various sections, such as property and casualty or group life insurance coverage. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage, defining it as term life insurance or accidental death coverage for a group of individuals under a single contract. This expands coverage options alongside property and casualty insurance. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage, expanding coverage options alongside property and casualty insurance. The amendment specifies that group life insurance policies can include named beneficiaries and must be included in the coverage. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage, expanding coverage options alongside property and casualty insurance. The amendment specifies new subparagraphs for periods of coverage. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage, expanding coverage options alongside property and casualty insurance. The amendment specifies new subparagraphs for periods of coverage, with amounts to be adjusted by the Secretary based on the increase in the Program caused by the inclusion of group life insurance. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage alongside property and casualty insurance. The amendment specifies new subparagraphs for coverage periods and adjustments in amounts by the Secretary. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include group life insurance coverage alongside property and casualty insurance. The Secretary of the Treasury is required to issue final regulations within 90 days. Additionally, a study on long-term solutions for terrorism insurance availability and affordability is mandated by June 1, 2005. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to extend the termination date to December 31, 2007. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to conduct a final study and report to Congress by June 30, 2007. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to extend the termination date to December 31, 2007. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to conduct a final study and report to Congress by June 30, 2007. "
